page.title: 14Christ Church Coseley
page.content: There are three churches within our vicinity but Christ Church is the largest;it was built in 1830. The Lady Chapel was built with the encouragement of William Spencer, great,great uncle of the Princess of Wales. The stained glass window is by the Pre-Raphaelites. The Chapel was begun in 1888,altered in 1897 and finally altered to its present form in 1910. The "Resurrection" window was added at the first rebuilding. Most of the work done in 1910 was a copy of the pre Raphaelite style. The intricate stenciling was based on the vine. It was carried out in green and purple and gold. The window is considered to be worth 100,000 pounds. William Spencer was very rich but tragically died while playing cricket on the nearby Coseley Cricket ground. The vicar (Rev J L Higgins has a strong connection with our school taking assembly once a week.
